info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 4:13PM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
info.description:
At 413 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mill Creek, or 11 miles southwest of Leland, moving southwest at 15 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Oak Island, Carolina Beach, Kure Beach, Snows Cut, South Masonboro Island, Boiling Spring Lakes, St. James, Bishop, Supply, Brunswick County Community College Main Campus, Mill Creek, Myrtle Grove, Silver Lake, Town Creek, Sea Breeze, Winnabow, Varnamtown, Bolivia, and Brunswick Novant Medical Center.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southeastern North Carolina.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL NEW HANOVER AND SOUTHEASTERN BRUNSWICK COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT

area.areaDesc: Inland New Hanover; Coastal New Hanover; Inland Brunswick; Coastal Brunswick
